Sentencas: Automotive Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) require improvements in mechanical robustness, power generation at low temperatures, and system compactness.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: To address these issues, we attempt to improve the internal reformation of metal-supported SOFCs (MS-SOFCs) via catalyst infiltration.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: After introducing nickel/gadolinium-doped ceria (Ni/GDC) nanoparticles, power densities of 1.16 Wcm-2 with hydrogen (3%H2O) and 0.85 Wcm-2 with methane (Steam-to-Carbon ratio, S/C = 1.0) are obtained at 600 & DEG;C, 0.7 V. This is the highest performance achieved in previous studies on MS-SOFCs.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: Internal reforming with various hydrocarbon is also demonstrated.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: In particular 0.64 Wcm-2 at 600 & DEG;C, 0.7 V is obtained when the fuel is iso-octane.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: We develop a numerical model to separately analyze reforming and electrochemical reaction.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: Catalyst infiltration dramatically increases the number of active sites for steam reforming.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures

Sentencas: In addition, ruthenium/gadolinium-doped ceria (Ru/GDC) should be suitable as a catalyst metal at low temperatures because of the lower activation energy of steam reforming.& COPY; 2023 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: Improvement of the internal reforming of metal-supported SOFC at low temperatures
